page.title: 05PEAT CUTTING, BONAR
page.content: Many people in our village burn{peat as fuel from their own{peat banks nearby. About the 2nd last week in May they start cutting the divots (which are big cubes of turf )so they can reach the peat. The tools which are used are called a{powersaw, rutter {spade and a hawk.}Then they start cutting the peats and spreading them to dry. The tool they use is a{peat {knife.}If there is any water running into the peat bank they have to dig a culvert to drain it. Then after a few weeks the peats are stacked into cubes. Once they are dry, they are bagged and taken home to burn. Most people build their peats into stacks near their homes.
